intro: Actinomeris nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed starwort, is a rare and delicate aquatic plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, leafless stems that bear small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and lakes. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and they bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Actinomeris nudicaulis is considered a species of conservation concern.
